body_html:
We aren't planning to add Iterator.has_next(), but are considering a non-throwing substitute for Iterator.get_next().

For the map/reduce style of computation, I'd recommend not using tf.while_loop() and an explicit iterator. Instead, use Dataset transformations like dataset.map(map_fn), tf.contrib.data.group_by_reducer() (note that this currently requires a nightly version of TF), and tf.contrib.data.get_single_element(). We plan to coalesce single-group tf.contrib.data.group_by_reducer() and tf.contrib.data.get_single_element() into a single reduce() method, and @jsimsa may be able to comment more on the plans there.

body:
We aren't planning to add `Iterator.has_next()`, but are considering a non-throwing substitute for `Iterator.get_next()`.

For the map/reduce style of computation, I'd recommend not using `tf.while_loop()` and an explicit iterator. Instead, use `Dataset` transformations like `dataset.map(map_fn)`, `tf.contrib.data.group_by_reducer()` (note that this currently requires a nightly version of TF), and `tf.contrib.data.get_single_element()`. We plan to coalesce single-group `tf.contrib.data.group_by_reducer()` and `tf.contrib.data.get_single_element()` into a single `reduce()` method, and @jsimsa may be able to comment more on the plans there.
